Person.definition: A participant of the design study, typically a user or stakeholder.

Computer_Expert.definition: A person with expertise in computer science, visual analytics or related fields.

Domain_Expert.definition: A person with expertise in the domain of interest for the design study.

Technical_Advisor.definition: A person who provides technical guidance and support for the design study.

User.definition: A person who uses the visual analytics tool or system developed in the design study.

Audience.definition: A person or group of people who observe or evaluate the design study.

Event.definition: An occurrence or happening during the design study.

Online_Meeting.definition: A virtual gathering of participants to discuss aspects of the design study.

Offline_Meeting.definition: A physical gathering of participants to discuss aspects of the design study.

Email.definition: A digital message exchanged between participants via email for formal communication.

Slack_Chat.definition: A digital message exchanged between participants via Slack for quick communication.

Development.definition: An activity related to the creation or improvement of the visual analytics tool or system.

Testing.definition: An activity related to evaluating the visual analytics tool or system.

Release.definition: An event marking the launch or deployment of the visual analytics tool or system.

Artifact.definition: A tangible or digital object produced or used during the design study.

Data.definition: Information collected and used for analysis in the design study.

Visualization.definition: Graphical representations of data created during the design study to aid understanding and communication.

Report.definition: A document summarizing findings, methodologies, and conclusions from the design study.

Proposal.definition: A document outlining the plan and objectives for the design study.

Prototype.definition: An early model or version of the visual analytics tool or system developed during the design study.

Software.definition: The visual analytics tool or system developed during the design study.

Tool.definition: A specific application or utility used to facilitate tasks in the design study.

System.definition: An integrated set of components working together to achieve the objectives of the design study.

Sketch.definition: A rough drawing or outline created during the design study to visualize ideas and concepts.

Notebook.definition: A document that combines code, visualizations, and narrative text to facilitate data analysis and sharing of results.

Algorithm.definition: A step-by-step procedure or formula for solving a problem or performing a task in the design study.

Presentation.definition: A structured display of information, often using slides, to communicate findings and insights from the design study.

Concept.definition: An abstract idea or principle relevant to the design study.

Weather_Event.definition: A meteorological occurrence that can impact various aspects of life and the environment.

Technical_Concept.definition: An idea or principle related to technology, computer science, or data analysis.

Domain_Concept.definition: An idea or principle specific to the domain of interest for the design study.

Design_Concept.definition: An idea or principle related to the design and development of visual analytics tools and systems.

Urban_Infrastructure.definition: The physical and organizational structures and facilities needed for the operation of a city or urban area.

Location.definition: A specific geographical point or area relevant to the design study.

Framework.definition: A structured approach or methodology used in the design study.

Timeline.definition: A sequence of events or milestones relevant to the design study.

Task.definition: A specific activity or objective that participants aim to accomplish during the design study.

Priority.definition: The level of importance or urgency assigned to tasks or objectives in the design study.

Problmem.definition: A challenge or issue that needs to be addressed during the design study.

Solution.definition: A method or approach developed to address a problem identified during the design study.

State.definition: A specific condition or status relevant to the design study.

Outcome.definition: The result or consequence of actions taken during the design study.
